name: FRigUnit_CCDIK
doc:
The CCID solver can solve N-Bone chains using
the Cyclic Coordinate Descent Inverse Kinematics algorithm.
For now this node supports single effector chains only.

StartBone: The first bone in the chain to solve
EffectorBone: The last bone in the chain to solve - the effector
EffectorTransform: The transform of the effector in global space
Precision: The precision to use for the fabrik solver
Weight: The weight of the solver - how much the IK should be applied.
MaxIterations: The maximum number of iterations. Values between 4 and 16 are common.
bStartFromTail: If set to true the direction of the solvers is flipped.
BaseRotationLimit: The general rotation limit to be applied to bones
RotationLimits: Defines the limits of rotation per bone.
bPropagateToChildren:
If set to true all of the global transforms of the children
of this bone will be recalculated based on their local transforms.
Note: This is computationally more expensive than turning it off.
ExecuteContext: * This property is used to chain multiple mutable units together
